Description: Bronze finger-ring comprised of a thin hoop soldered to a round flat bezel containing a rosette formed by four looped sections of bronze wire.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Curator's comments: Cf., Stolz 2007, nos 143–45. For similarly constructed bronze rings, but with text inscribed on the flat surface of the round bezel, see Strzygowski 1904, nos 7045–46. Depicted top right in Griffith Institute Archive J. de M. Johnson excavation photograph (O’Connell forthcoming, fig. 111). O’Connell, Elisabeth R. Forthcoming. John de Monins Johnson’s 1913/14 Egypt Exploration Fund expedition to Antinoupolis (Antinoë), with appendix of objects, in Antinoupolis II: Scavi e material III, ed. R. Pintaudi. Florence: Istituto papirologico “G. Vitelli. Stolz, Y. 2007. Byzantine jewellery and related small finds from the underwater excavations in the Bay of Abuqir in Egypt: Their typology, production and context. Unpublished PhD diss. Oxford University. Strzygowski, J. 1904. Koptische Kunst. Catalogue général des antiquités égyptiennes du Musée du Caire. Vienne: A. Holzhausen.
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (36)
